title: 07 | Intro to Cassandra - What's Next?
description:
Welcome to the Intro to Cassandra Crash Course! In this video series, we'll go over the basics of how Apache Cassandra works and get hands on with implementing a basic Cassandra Database in the cloud!

ðŸ’» Create your Cassandra Database:
https://astra.dev/cassandra-course

ðŸ“¥ Workshop Materials:
https://github.com/DataStax-Academy/Intro-to-Cassandra-for-Developers

Learn more about Cassandra at Apache (https://cassandra.apache.org/doc/latest/)  and DataStax (https://docs.datastax.com/en/landing_page/doc/landing_page/cassandra.html) documentation websites.

CONNECT WITH DATASTAX
Subscribe: http://www.youtube.com/c/datastaxdevs?sub_confirmation=1 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/datastaxdevs
Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/datastaxdevs

About DataStax:
DataStax is the company behind the massively scalable, highly available, cloud-native NoSQL data platform built on Apache Cassandraâ„¢. DataStax gives developers and enterprises the freedom to run data in any cloud, Kubernetes, hybrid or bare metal at global scale with zero downtime and zero lock-in. More than 450 of the worldâ€™s leading enterprises including Capital One, Cisco, Comcast, Delta Airlines, Macyâ€™s, McDonaldâ€™s, Safeway, Sony, and Walmart use DataStax to build transformational data architectures for real-world outcomes. For more, visit DataStax.com and @DataStax.

About DataStax Developer:
On the DataStax Developers YouTube channel, you can find tutorials, workshops and much more to help you learn and stay updated with the latest information on Apache CassandraÂ©.  Visit https://datastax.com/dev for more free learning resources.

transcript.text: well hello again and welcome to what's next in video seven seven of our intro to cassandra for developers crash course so here all i wanna do is very briefly give you a whole set of resources that you can use to continue your learning your interaction with the community everything that you might need to know to get deeper into cassandra first thing here is going to be academy.datastax.com academy is really a great place to go if you really want to dig more into the fundamentals more into data modeling essentially because we only scratch the surface with the topics that we touched here today in this crash course so you can go there and get a lot more knowledge there's also datasacks.com dev as a matter of fact i'm going to provide some links in the video description that will bring you directly to some of the cassandra fundamentals and data modeling courses there and what's really cool about slash dev is you can run cassandra right there it's an it's an embedded experience it'll run right in your browser it'll spin up a cassandra instance for you and everything and you can go through all of the examples and tutorials another one here is community.datastacks.com think of this like stack overflow for cassandra so anything here dealing with magic cassandra if you have technical questions you know if you're running your own clusters and um you run into you know some snag or something or if you're working through a data modeling exercise whatever community.datasex.com is a really good great place to go to get experts from all around the world who can help answer your queries and then finally here we have our data stacks developers youtube channel uh where we are always putting out new content including a crash course just like this we have workshops that we do all sorts of materials that are showing up there and if you subscribe then you'll be notified every time something new happens so you can help level up your game in cassandra and all the other things we talk about there um we do weekly workshops so every week we have some workshop going on both in latin america north america and on wednesdays usually and then we have our emea and apac regions on thursday where we do the same workshop we usually have at least one new topic that's coming out each month but we have workshops every week so definitely something to come take a look at we get into the application world how do you build applications with the cassandra cassandra fundamentals itself data modeling kubernetes doing things with cassandra and kubernetes all sorts of things so definitely come take a look at our workshops where we get to interact with you and you get to ask your questions live and then finally our discord channel our fellowship of the rings discord channel this is really a great place to come and if if you're actively working on stuff maybe you're in one of our workshops or maybe you have your own cluster or whatever and you want to just be able to chat with us at any given time 24 7. come to the discord channel you can see the bitly link is up there bitly cassandra dash workshop um we're always there right and this community is 10 000 strong right now we have all sorts of folks from the cassandra community who are there with us on the channel come join be a part of the channel with us and finally thank you so much for joining us in our intro to cassandra ford developers crash course i hope you enjoy this and that you got something out of it and we will see you again here real soon for the next one take care
